_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Wednesday January 28th 2026 | 5:33

Bonjour Tremblant!

Expect a cold start on the mountain this morning, so be sure to dress warmly! Temperatures will rise as the day goes on. Overnight snowfall delivered 3 cm of fresh snow, and our mountain teams have everything open—102 trails, top to bottom. Fresh turns and full access make for excellent skiing and riding today. 

Glade Skiing: With fresh snow falling daily, glade skiing is outstanding right now. We have 17 gladed runs open, offering playful turns, great coverage, and some of the best conditions of the season.

Terrain Parks: Park riders have plenty to choose from today, with all 4 terrain parks open, featuring a variety of features for different ability levels.

For those heading off the groomers, Alpine Touring and Snowshoeing conditions are excellent, with all 15 sectors open and looking beautiful today.

First Tracks: Enjoy early access starting at 7:45 a.m. on select lifts on both the North and South sides of the mountain.

Have an amazing day out there—stay warm and enjoy every turn!

Mountain safety tip of the week:  Always stay in control to ensure you can stop and avoid others or obstacles.
 
Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.Alert: In order to meet Hydro-Québec's requirements for January 29, 2026, the first tracks on north side will be at the Expo and Lowell Thomas lifts. The opening of the Soleil and Duncan lifts will be delayed to10 a.m. Consequently, the opening of the Soleil slope will be postponed to10 a.m.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: Happy Wednesday! We picked up 3 cm of fresh snow overnight. It’s a cold start this morning, so bundle up. Enjoy 102 runs open, 4 snow parks, 17 gladed trails, and 15 areas open for alpine touring and snowshoeing. Have an amazing day on the mountain, stay warm,  and ski safe! Mountain safety tip of the week: Always stay in control to ensure you can stop and avoid others or obstacles.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench: Bon mercredi! Nous avons reçu 3 cm de neige. Il fait froid ce matin, habillez-vous chaudement. Profitez de 102 pistes ouvertes, 4 parcs à neige et 17 sous-bois. Passez une superbe journée, restez bien au chaud et profitez de chaque virage! Conseil de sécurité en montagne de la semaine: Gardez le contrôle en tout temps afin de pouvoir vous arrêter et éviter les personnes ou obstacles.
